title: Denver advances, but Bo Nix is out: Six questions about where the Broncos go from here
content: The Broncos advanced to the AFC title game but lost their QB to a broken ankle. So what's next for them on their Super Bowl quest?

title: Broncos' Nix breaks bone in ankle, out for playoffs
content: Broncos quarterback Bo Nix will miss the remainder of the playoffs after breaking a bone in his right ankle during overtime of Saturday's 33-30 win over the Bills, coach Sean Payton said.

title: Seahawks showcase full arsenal, blow out 49ers
content: The Seahawks delivered an all-three-phases beatdown of the 49ers on Saturday, racing to a 17-0 lead and never looking back in a 41-6 win to advance to the NFC title game.

title: Falcons hire Stefanski hours after 2nd interview
content: The Atlanta Falcons hired Kevin Stefanski, 43, as their new coach, the club announced on Saturday night, after the former Cleveland Browns coach, who is a two-time NFL Coach of the Year, had his second interview with the team earlier in the day.

title: Allen devastated, but loss not on QB, Bills say
content: After another playoff loss that ended a promising season for the Bills, quarterback Josh Allen told reporters that "I feel like I let my teammates down tonight," though Buffalo players and coaches disagreed after the Broncos won 33-30 on Saturday night.

title: Bills' McDermott rips refs' ruling on pivotal INT
content: Bills coach Sean McDermott wasn't happy with the way officials handled a critical overtime play that resulted in a Broncos interception Saturday, saying it was "too big of a play" not to stop the game and review it.

title: Spurs outlast Edwards despite 55-point barrage
content: Less than a week after blowing a big early lead in a loss to Minnesota, the Spurs held on for the win Saturday despite a 55-point effort from Anthony Edwards.

title: Sources: Packers' LaFleur back on multiyear deal
content: The Packers are keeping Matt LaFleur as head coach on a multiyear extension that represents a "real commitment," sources told ESPN.

title: 'Honored' Harbaugh agrees to Giants' 5-year deal
content: Former Baltimore Ravens coach John Harbaugh, 63, agreed to the five-year deal the New York Giants offered him earlier this week, the club announced Saturday night, and sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter that the contract is for $20 million per season.

title: ðŸ‘€ Offseason guide for all eliminated NFL teams
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 26 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: Key questions about close officiating calls in the Broncos' win over the Bills
content: When is a catch a catch and how much contact draws a penalty flag were in dispute Saturday in Denver.

title: Sizing up overreactions, big questions from the divisional round: Why do the Bills keep falling short?
content: Another Super Bowl-less season for Buffalo? But are the Broncos also done? And did Seattle ace last offseason? Let's make sense of every divisional round game.

title: Guide to two more divisional round games: Previews, bold predictions, more
content: Texans-Patriots? Rams-Bears? We have picks, predictions and stats to know for the divisional round games.

title: Kevin Stefanski to Falcons: Grading the hire and the impact on Penix
content: Kevin Stefanski didn't have a great record in Cleveland, but he'll have more talent to work with in Atlanta.

title: John Harbaugh to the Giants! Eight questions and a grade for New York's move
content: The 63-year-old has been able to call his own shot in this coaching search and wound up choosing the Giants.

title: Men's: Duke is a 1-seed again
content: Is the ACC back? Eight single-digit seeds -- including one on the top line -- and a couple of bubble teams would suggest so.

title: Women's: South Carolina ascends to No. 2 overall
content: Texas, which fell at South Carolina on Thursday, tumbles to the final No. 1 seed after its second straight loss.

title: Man United deliver huge blow to Man City title hopes with shock derby win
content: Manchester City's title bid is as good as over after Manchester United won the midfield battle at Old Trafford.

title: How Mike Tomlin spent his final day as the Steelers head coach
content: 'It was dead silent' when the coach stunned the Steelers' locker room. Here's what we know about what's next.

title: Giannis and the Bucks: Four possible pathways forward in Milwaukee at the deadline
content: The Bucks and Antetokounmpo currently sit in 11th place ahead of the trade deadline. What are their options?

title: Meet 'the special 13': The JMU transfers forming an unlikely Indiana CFP title core
content: Thirteen Dukes players followed Curt Cignetti to become Hoosiers. Those who remain are on the verge of CFB history.

title: A historic Indiana or the restored U -- who has the edge in the CFP title game?
content: Will the Hoosiers cap an undefeated season, or can the Canes pull off a stunner? Here are the keys to the game.

title: 'First round's on me': DePaul coach Holtmann covers drinks for students after Marquette win
content: Chris Holtmann seems to have DePaul moving in the right direction. And after record student attendance, the coach gave back in a very collegiate manner: free drinks.

title: Wetzel: Accused hoops schemers were not victims of a changing society
content: These players selfishly betrayed their common sense, their teammates and, ultimately, themselves, Wetzel says.

title: 'This was too easy': Inside six college basketball games the feds allege were rigged
content: Prosecutors allege a gambling ring bribed 39 NCAA players to fix dozens of games. Here's a closer look.

title: Rising prices, plenty of QBs and 1,200 players without a home
content: The transfer portal closes today for most players. Here are five things to know after two wild weeks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern, Chelsea to fight for Rennes' JÃ©rÃ©my Jacquet
content: Bayern Munich and Chelsea could go head-to-head for Rennes' JÃ©rÃ©my Jacquet. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: GÃ¼ler to Arsenal? Chelsea squad changes?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Mumbai cha mayor kon? Suspense grows as Shiv Sena eyes first 2.5 years in BMC
content: Mumbai's mayoral race remains uncertain despite the BJP-Shinde Sena alliance's clear majority. Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT) vows to fight for their mayor, accusing rivals of betrayal. Meanwhile, the ruling alliance assures a consensus candidate, with power-sharing talks underway, leaving the final decision pending.

title: â€˜Bomb on boardâ€™: IndiGo flight makes emergency landing; message written on toilet paper triggers alert
content: A Delhi to Bagdogra flight made an emergency landing in Lucknow on Sunday. This happened after a bomb threat was reported. A message claiming a bomb was on board was found in the aircraft's toilet. The flight carried 238 passengers and crew. Security agencies are conducting a thorough search of the aircraft in Lucknow.

title: 'BJP people's 1st choice': PM Modi hails major BMC win; hits out at Congress in Assam
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the BJP's continuous rise, highlighting recent electoral successes in Bihar and Mumbai's BMC elections, where the party secured a historic mandate. He also laid the foundation stone for the Kaziranga Elevated Corridor in Assam, aimed at enhancing wildlife safety and boosting ecotourism. â€‹PM Modi's remark comes days after BJP pulled off a massive victory in Mumbai's BMC elections, wresting power from the ally-turned-rival Uddhav Thackeray.

title: â€˜He was screaming for helpâ€™: Techie drowns as car falls into pit in Noida; hereâ€™s what happened
content: In a heartbreaking incident, a software developer lost his life when his SUV plunged into a flooded construction pit in Noida. After crashing through a compromised wall, he desperately attempted to remain on the vehicle's roof, calling for help. However, thick fog obscured visibility, and the delayed response of rescue teams resulted in tragic consequences.

title: â€˜Canâ€™t wait to start the trialâ€™: Elon Musk sends â€˜open warningâ€™ to OpenAI CEO Sam Altman
content: Elon Musk anticipates a dramatic trial against OpenAI, accusing the AI firm of defrauding him by abandoning its non-profit mission.  He seeks $134 billion in damages. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman countered, sharing call notes suggesting Musk pushed for a for-profit structure and majority equity, even proposing his children control AGI.

title: â€˜Hotel turned into jailâ€™: Raut's big charge against Shinde; claims corporators in â€˜captivityâ€™
content: Mumbai's mayoral race remains uncertain. Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut alleges Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena corporators oppose a BJP mayor. He claims many are in contact with his party. Shinde's corporators are reportedly housed in a luxury hotel. The BJP and Shinde-led Sena alliance holds a majority in the municipal corporation. Power-sharing discussions are ongoing.

title: Thousands killed: Khamenei blames US; Trump demands new leadership â€” what's happening in Iran
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has acknowledged thousands of deaths during recent nationwide protests, a rare admission amid a harsh crackdown. Khamenei blamed the United States and foreign actors for orchestrating the unrest, which began over economic issues but evolved into anti-regime demonstrations. US President Donald Trump condemned the violence and called for new leadership in Iran.

title: Coffeemakers are new centerpieces? India splurging lakhs for cafe-like coffee at home
content: Affluent Indians are transforming their kitchens into home cafes, investing heavily in high-end coffee machines and specialty beans. This trend, driven by a desire to replicate overseas experiences and dissatisfaction with local offerings, sees premium models becoming lifestyle statements. The market is booming, with sales of premium machines surging as consumers seek quality and prestige.

title: Who is Aditya Dhar? 'Dhurandhar' director who gave Bollywood one of its biggest hits
content: Director Aditya Dhar has achieved significant success with his patriotic and spy thrillers. His film 'Uri The Surgical Strike' became a national sensation. He followed this with 'Article 370' and the record-breaking spy thriller 'Dhurandhar'. Dhar focuses on realistic portrayals and impactful storytelling. He co-founded B62 Studios and is married to actress Yami Gautam.

title: Plot to destabilise Punjab? Pak sent Turkish, Chinese weapons seized in Pathankot
content: Punjab Police thwarted a potential terror attack by recovering a significant weapons cache in Narot Jamal Singh. The seizure included three AK-47 rifles, pistols, and ammunition, believed to be sent from Pakistan by terrorist Harvinder Singh alias Rinda. This timely interception prevented a major attack planned by Rinda's associates.

title: Ex-White House Asia advisor on Nvidia selling to China; calls Trump-era logic a â€˜fantasyâ€™
content: Former Trump advisor Matt Pottinger has slammed the administration's approval of Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China, warning it could "supercharge" Beijing's military.  Critics argue this undermines the US AI race, while the administration claims it discourages Chinese competitors. New Chinese regulations now require chip reviews and limit import volumes, demanding assurances against military use.

title: $1 billion entry fee? Trump wants countries to pay to stay in his 'board of peace' â€” what we know
content: A draft charter suggests US President Trump's proposed "Board of Peace" could require a $1 billion contribution for permanent membership, sparking concerns of an alternative to the UN. Trump would chair the board, with membership renewal at his discretion. However, the White House has labelled the report misleading, denying any minimum fee and stating permanent membership is for committed partners.

title: 'Never meant to hurt': AR Rahman on criticisms over 'communal bias' remark
content: Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman clarified his recent remarks on alleged bias in Bollywood, stating his words were misunderstood and he never intended to cause pain. He expressed gratitude for India's artistic freedom and highlighted his diverse musical projects, emphasizing his deep connection to his homeland and its rich culture. Rahman's clarification follows social media criticism.

title: Mumbai mayoral race: Voting set for January 28; reservation, selection process explained
content: Mumbai's next mayor will be elected by corporators on January 28, 2026, following a lottery to determine the post's reservation category. The candidate with the most votes will win, with nominated corporators potentially influencing the outcome in the 227-member BMC House.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: Steelers nation demands change after Tomlin's steelers exit
content: Steelers Nation has accepted Mike Tomlin's departure after nearly two decades, with a poll showing 64.79% of fans believing it was the right decision. While acknowledging his past success and Super Bowl title, fans expressed frustration with recent playoff disappointments and conservative play-calling. Tomlin is reportedly considering a move to television.

title: Stephen Curry pens 'keep shooting' for Klay Thompson's 3-point mark
content: Klay Thompson has officially become the NBA's fourth all-time leader in three-pointers, surpassing Damian Lillard with 2,805 made.  This remarkable achievement, despite past injuries, drew praise from former teammate Stephen Curry.  The duo, once a legendary backcourt, continues to share mutual respect and support even after Thompson's move to Dallas.

title: 'Got the benefit of ... ': Ayush Badoni opens up on maiden India call-up
content: Delhi cricketer Ayush Badoni's career took a turn after focusing on bowling, transforming him into an all-rounder and earning him a maiden India call-up. The 26-year-old was added to the ODI squad against New Zealand, hoping for an opportunity to make an impact at the international level.

title: 'We're under your custody': Mamata attacks â€˜agenciesâ€™ in CJI's presence
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee urged Chief Justice of India Surya Kant to protect democracy and prevent agencies from defaming citizens. Speaking at the inauguration of the Jalpaiguri circuit bench, she emphasized the judiciary's role as guardians of the Constitution and the country. CJI Kant lauded the establishment of the circuit bench for judicial decentralization.

title: Maha poll 'tie-up' talk: Owaisi rules out BJP-NDA alliance; AIMIM corporators told to withdraw
content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi firmly ruled out any alliance with the BJP or NDA, emphasizing the party's non-negotiable ideological stance. He clarified a local episode in Maharashtra where corporators supported a BJP candidate was an error, with show-cause notices issued. Owaisi stressed that only party leadership decides alliances, rejecting any perception of ideological dilution.

title: Kabaddi player's murder: Accused shot in encounter
content: Karan 'Defaulter' Pathak, the main shooter in a kabaddi player's murder, was killed in a police encounter in Mohali after escaping custody. Pathak had fled while being transported to a hospital, leading to a manhunt. He was later traced and fatally wounded when he allegedly fired at police.

title: Amrit Bharat Express expands: PM Modi flags off 2 trains in Assam; 3 more lined up
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be inaugrating five new Amrit Bharat Express trains, expanding India's long-distance rail network. These new services aim to enhance travel experience and connectivity for the common man, with key routes connecting various regions including the North-East, North India, and South India.

title: Another embarrassment: Falling bird's nest debris halts India Open semifinal
content: India Open badminton tournament marred by administrative blunders. A women's doubles semifinal was halted as bird's nest debris fell onto the court, following earlier incidents of bird droppings. Players have raised concerns about unhygienic conditions and venue readiness, questioning the event's suitability for a premier BWF tournament.

title: 'Shaken & terrified': Student beaten with belt by seniors at Doon Medical College; probe on
content: A first-year MBBS student at Doon Medical College has alleged that two senior students took him off-campus and beat him with a belt. The student reported the incident, stating he was left "shaken and terrified" and feared retribution. The college principal confirmed an investigation by the anti-ragging committee is underway, with findings expected next week.

title: One womanâ€™s first flight, and the silent shift in Indiaâ€™s handloom story
content: Rukmini's journey from a village artisan to an acknowledged artist in Delhi highlights Indian Silk House Agencies' mission. The company elevates weavers by documenting their craft and connecting them directly to markets. This initiative, rooted in decades of fair dealings, is fostering a quiet revolution, bringing recognition and value to the often-invisible human labor behind India's â‚¹80,000 crore saree industry.

title: Bill Belichick lands new ESPN role as North Carolina looks ahead after 4â€“8 season
content: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPNâ€™s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolinaâ€™s head coach ended at 4â€“8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heelsâ€™ April 12 spring game.

title: Maha civic polls: Shinde corrals his 29 corporators in hotel; CM rules out poaching
content: Amid ongoing power-sharing discussions with the BJP, the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena has gathered its 29 new corporators at a prominent Mumbai hotel. With aspirations to secure the mayor's role for the initial 2.5 years and crucial committee positions, the Sena argues for justice in representation.

title: Handshake drama explained: BCB breaks silence on Ind vs Ban U-19 World Cup incident
content: A controversy arose during the U-19 World Cup match between India and Bangladesh as captains failed to exchange a customary handshake at the toss. The Bangladesh Cricket Board clarified the incident was unintentional, stemming from a lapse in concentration, and emphasized their commitment to sportsmanship amid existing cricketing tensions.

title: 'Not going down without a fightâ€™: Thousands march in Greenland amid Trump's takeover threat
content: Thousands of Greenlanders protested against US President Donald Trump's renewed pressure to acquire the Arctic island, asserting their right to self-rule. Demonstrations in Nuuk and other cities voiced strong opposition to being "for sale," with Greenland's prime minister joining the rallies. The protests intensified following Trump's announcement of tariffs on goods from countries opposing US control.

title: Siraj ducks Arshdeep 'bouncer', says happy with Harshit as partner
content: Mohammed Siraj, recently appointed captain of the Hyderabad Ranji Trophy team, expressed his honor and excitement for the new role. He also addressed his absence from the T20 World Cup squad, clarifying he was rested from the South Africa ODI series to manage workload and prepare for future tournaments.

title: Bigg Boss Tamil 9 poll winner: Divya or Sabari, who will lift the trophy?
content: As Bigg Boss Tamil 9's grand finale approaches, wild card contestant Divya leads ETimes TV's poll with 70% of votes, positioning her as the predicted winner. Sabari follows at 18%, with Aurora and Vikram trailing. The charismatic Vijay Sethupathi will crown the champion tonight.

title: Side hustle ends a Google career: Why this Bengaluru engineer was forced to quit
content: The resignation of Google engineer Arpit Bhayani over his educational side work has become a symbol of a deeper shift in Indiaâ€™s tech workforce. As freelancing surges and moonlighting checks tighten, companies and employees are drifting out of sync. The story reflects a growing tension between rigid corporate rules and a workforce that has quietly embraced flexible, parallel careers.

title: Trumpâ€™s 10% tariffs: Macron slams â€˜unacceptableâ€™ threats; EU warns against blackmailing
content: European leaders strongly condemned President Trump's proposed tariffs on goods from several European nations, warning of severe damage to transatlantic relations.  They emphasized that Greenland's future is not subject to economic coercion and stressed that Arctic security cooperation should not become a trade dispute.  European officials vowed a united response to uphold sovereignty.

title: Bigg Boss Kannada 12 winner: Gilli Nata leads by a mile in ETimes poll
content: As Bigg Boss Kannada 12 nears its grand finale, fan polls indicate Gilli Nata is the clear audience favorite, securing a commanding 63% of votes. Ashwini Gowda and Rakshitha Shetty jointly hold the second position with 19% each, while Mutant Raghu follows with 16%.

title: Motherâ€™s parenting fear sparks viral conversation, actor Aparshakti Khurana reacts
content: A viral video captures a mother's poignant fear of her children eventually choosing not to rely on them. A father's calm response reframes this anxiety, emphasizing that raising independent children capable of forging their own paths is the ultimate success. This relatable sentiment resonated deeply with parents globally, including actor Aparshakti Khurana, who praised the video's profound message.

title: Jan 6 rioter claims he was â€˜lynchedâ€™ during clash with antiâ€‘ICE protestersâ€” watch
content: A small pro-ICE rally led by Jake Lang, a January 6 rioter recently pardoned by President Donald Trump, was overwhelmed by a much larger counter protest in Minneapolis. The confrontation turned chaotic as demonstrators forced Lang to retreat. After the rally, Lang claimed on social media that he had been attacked and stabbed.

title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi-NCR: AQI â€˜severeâ€™ at 439; cold wave keeps visibility poor
content: Several areas across the city reported alarmingly high pollution levels, reflecting the widespread nature of the pollution crisis. Anand Vihar recorded an AQI of 489, Ashok Vihar 463, Bawana 467, Chandni Chowk 464, Dwarka Sector 8 469, ITO 448, Narela 412, Punjabi Bagh 476, RK Puram 467 and Wazirpur 478. All these locations fell under the 'severe' category, indicating extremely poor air quality and heightened health risks.

title: Proud home record at stake! India face New Zealand in series decider
content: India aims to maintain their strong home ODI record against New Zealand in the series decider. While Kohli and Rahul are in form, Kuldeep Yadav's struggles are a concern. New Zealand, with an inexperienced squad, seeks a historic ODI series win in India, led by Daryl Mitchell's impressive batting.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection: India gross total to hit Rs 1000 crore
content: Despite a slow start to its seventh week, 'Dhurandhar' is making waves at the box office, nearing Rs 1000 crore domestically. The film's impressive week 7 performance places it third for the week, showcasing its enduring appeal. With a global collection exceeding Rs 1278 crore, it's on track to challenge box office giants.

title: 'Inspired by Udaanâ€™: UP RPF officer saved 1,500 kids; honoured with Railwaysâ€™ highest award
content: Railway Protection Force Inspector Chandana Sinha has been honored for her exceptional work in rescuing over 1,500 children from UP's rail network. Her innovative system, built on trained officers and NGO partnerships, effectively spots and intercepts vulnerable children, including those trafficked for labor. Sinha's dedication has made her a model for child rescue initiatives.

title: Delhi blast probe: ED flags 'terror-linked faculty' at Al-Falah; assets seized
content: In a shocking revelation, University Chancellor Javed Ahmad Siddiqui is under scrutiny for allegedly hiring Dr. Umar Nabi, associated with the Red Fort bombing, along with two others, at Al-Falah University, bypassing necessary police background checks.

title: The silent curriculum: What Indian colleges overlook, but employers expect from graduates
content: Indian higher education's employability gap stems from a 'silent curriculum' largely missing for most students. Industry exposure, applied learning, certifications, and alumni networks, crucial for job readiness, remain theoretical for many. This invisible curriculum, not on transcripts, dictates outcomes, leaving degrees signaling education but not guaranteed professional readiness.

title: 'If it was Kohli in Babar's place': Ex-Pak cricketer on Smith controversy in BBL
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali sparked debate after defending Steve Smith in the Babar Azam controversy during a Big Bash League match. After Smith refused a single and then smashed a record 32-run over, Babar was dismissed soon after. Basit blamed Babar and controversially said Smith would never deny Virat Kohli a run. Kamran Akmal disagreed, calling Smithâ€™s act disrespectful.

title: Man dies after car plunges into water-filled pit in Greater Noida; initial probe says â€˜fog, overspeedingâ€™ led to incident
content: The deceased was identified as a 27-year-old software engineer with a company in Gurugram; local residents staged a protest alleging negligence

title: Bomb threat in Delhi-Bagdogra IndiGo flight forces emergency landing in Lucknow
content: During preliminary checks, a handwritten note on a tissue paper bearing the words "Plane mein bomb" (bomb in the plane) was found, police said

title: Amravati civic polls: 22 BJP candidates claim Navneet Rana campaigned against party
content: They claimed that former Amravati Lok Sabha MP Navneet Rana aggressively dubbed the saffron party nominees as "dummies" and promoted contestants of her husband Ravi Rana's Yuva Swabhiman Party as the "real BJP candidates"

title: Bus collides with car amid thick fog in U.P., two dead
content: â€œThe accident occurred near Babu Ganj on the Raebareli-Sultanpur highway. The collision took place due to poor visibility caused by thick fog,â€ says police

title: BJPâ€™s responsibility to ensure Mumbaiâ€™s progress: Omar Abdullah
content: The election took place after a long gap. In every election, somebody wins, and somebody lags behind. The BJP secured the maximum number of seats. It becomes their responsibility to ensure progress of Mumbai, says CM Omar Abdullah

title: Former CPI(M) MLA S. Rajendran joins BJP
content: Rajendran had represented the Devikulam constituency in Idukki district as s CPI(M) member in 2006, 2011 and 2016

title: Centre urged to honour N.T. Rama Rao with Bharata Ratna award
content: NTR, as he was popularly known, had brought changes in the administrative setup with the formation of mandals as part of taking services closer to the people

title: Remarks against Col. Sofiya Qureshi: SC to hear plea of MP Minister Vijay Shah
content: On July 28, 2025, the top court had pulled up Vijay Shah for not placing a public apology over his remarks on record against Col Qureshi, saying he was "testing the court's patience"

title: CM tells officials to focus on completion of irrigation projects
content: Due priority must be accorded to widening of the Handri-Neeva canals and Veligonda, Uttarandhra, and Nallamala Sagar projects, he advised

title: Need to erase caste from mind to end discrimination: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: Responding to questions from the audience, Mr. Bhagwat said the Sangh aims to lead India to its ultimate glory along with society

title: 1.3 crore devotees take holy dip on Mauni Amavasya morning at Sangam in Uttar Pradesh
content: Earlier, about 1.03 crore devotees had taken a dip on the occasion of Makar Sankranti, while nearly 85 lakh people bathed in the Ganga and Sangam on Ekadashi

title: WEF 2026: India readies power-packed presence before global elite
content: From India, at least four Union Ministersâ€” Ashwini Vaishnaw, Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Pralhad Joshi, and K Rammohan Naidu â€” as well as six Chief Ministers are expected to be there, along with over 100 top CEOs from the country

title: Former Maharashtra BJP Minister Raj Purohit passes away at 71
content: A well-known figure in Mumbai BJP circles, he had served as the party's city president and a Minister in the Maharashtra government, and was the BJP's chief whip in the Assembly between 2014 and 2019

title: PM Modi lays foundation stone for â‚¹6,957-crore Kaziranga corridor, flags off two Amrit Bharat trains
content: The Kaziranga project has been designed in compliance with the directions of the Supreme Court and the recommendations of the Wildlife Institute of India

title: GBS outbreak claims two lives in MP; govt. ramps up detection, treatment
content: Following the detection of over a dozen cases in Manasa town, the authorities have been instructed to establish a control room there, create a special ward for GBS patients at the local government hospital, and make other necessary arrangements to tackle the outbreak

title: Samajwadi Party to move Supreme Court on electoral transparency: Akhilesh
content: We are planning to move the Supreme Court to verify whether the voter list prepared by the Election Commission is valid or the list compiled by the State Election Commission is accurate, says Akhilesh Yadav

title: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis, U.S. Envoy Gor discuss boosting investments and business ties
content: The two sides explored opportunities to enhance U.S. investments in Maharashtra and support State-based companies looking to expand their presence in the U.S., he said

title: In Frames: Prayerful in Prayagraj
content: Ceremonies for the Magh Mela, which began on January 3, have been drawing crores of devotees to the Triveni Sangam for a holy dip; a footfall of 15-20 crore is expected by the culmination of the festival on Mahasivaratri; pilgrims offer prayers amid tight security arrangements and bustling crowds

title: Two militants arrested in Manipur's Bishnupur
content: At Chairel Ahallup in the district, a member of the outlawed PREPAK (Pro) was arrested on Saturday, a police officer said

title: 8 FIRs filed as â€˜fake imagesâ€™ of Manikarnika Ghat redevelopment surface online
content: According to the police, fabricated images and misleading content, contrary to the actual facts related to the ongoing beautification work at Manikarnika Ghat, were shared on social media platform X

title: Dense fog shrouds Delhi, air quality severe
content: The India Meteorological Department has also placed the city under a yellow alert, warning of dense fog at many isolated places till forenoon

title: In Haryana, the birth of a son
content: Haryanaâ€™s Dhani Bhojraj village witnessed exuberant festivities when a 37-year-old woman gave birth to a boy after 18 years and 10 daughters.Â Ashna ButaniÂ visits the village and finds out how the familyâ€™sÂ â€˜wish for a sonâ€™ is rooted in persistent social taunts and an enduring cultural longing for a male child even as the Stateâ€™s sex ratio steadily improves

title: Has an Arbitration Council been constituted? | Explained
content: What would be the functions of the Arbitration Council of India? Why have there been concerns with respect to institutional impartiality? What are some of the criticisms of the amendments? What does the draft Arbitration and Conciliation (Amendment) Bill, 2024 propose?

title: Ahmedabadâ€“Gandhinagar Metro ridership rises fourfold in three years
content: More than 11.50 crore passengers travelled on the Ahmedabadâ€“Gandhinagar Metro between October 2022 and December 2025

title: AMMKâ€™s decision on alliance to be revealed by leader of senior partner, says Dhinakaran
content: The AMMK leader reiterates that no party will secure an absolute majority of its own in the upcoming Assembly election and there will be a coalition government in the State

title: Excluding Awami League from upcoming election will not bring stability to Bangladesh, says party leader in Delhi
content: Former Foreign Minister Hasan Mahmud acknowledges Indiaâ€™s support to Awami League, which remains banned in Bangladesh

title: Three migrant labourers dead in mudslip at construction site in the Nilgiris; probe on
content: The police have registered a case and are investigating whether the land owners and the people in-charge of the construction project had necessary permissions and had taken safety measures

title: Body of Kerala tourist retrieved from high-altitude Arunachal lake
content: The district administration will write to the State government to barricade Sela Lake, where the accident occurred

title:
Water, all the time: Chennai
moves to fix piped supply
content: MetrowaterÂ has set out to try something new in Chennai: it decided to trial a project to supply 24/7 piped water in the AdyarÂ zone, signalling a significant shift in Chennaiâ€™s evolving water management strategy. Chennai has begun the process to replace intermittent supply with a pressurised network, reshaping how the city plans, consumes and governs water

title: Post-Sankranti return chokes NH-65; bumper-to-bumper traffic as Hyderabad-bound rush peaks
content: At Suryapet, police recorded an average of 40 vehicles passing every one-and-a-half minutes in the evening, with surveillance drones deployed along the highway for continue monitoring of the inflow.

title: U.P. CM Adityanath accuses Congress of spreading â€˜false propagandaâ€™ on Kashi redevelopment
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister says Kashi is witnessing unprecedented spiritual, cultural and infrastructural transformation over the past 11 years, with a sharp rise in pilgrim footfall and major contributions to the economy

title: Punjab CM meets Amit Shah, opposes Seeds Bill 2025
content: Chief Minister Mann said that despite clear statutory provisions under the relevant Punjab Acts, Rural Development Fund has not been reimbursed to the State government

title: SIT expedites probe into death of Bihar NEET aspirant
content: The 18-year-old was found unconscious in her hostel room in Patna earlier this month and died during treatment on January 11; sexual violence canâ€™t be ruled out,  post-mortem report says

title: Cleaning up the sins of the Opposition: PM in Assam
content: At an event to celebrate Bodo heritage, PM says Opposition exploited problems for their political benefit, treating infiltrators as a loyal votebank, and sowing division where there should have been trust

title: Modi govt. communalising education, says Congress
content: Party seeks probe into withdrawal of permission for MBBS course at Jammuâ€™s Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute and the demolition of a school built by a Muslim in Madhya Pradesh

title: Madhya Pradesh government to build memorial at the site of Bhopal gas tragedy: CM Yadav
content: Chief Minister Mohan Yadav targets the Congress, accusing it of abandoning victims and helping former Union Carbide CEO Warren Anderson escape

title: Residents stage road blockade demanding capture of stray leopard
content: The leopard has killed at least seven head of cattle since December,Â causing fear among residents and raising concerns over safety after dark. Forest officials say they are planning to set traps

title: Civic polls: BJP high command may overrule State unitâ€™s resistance to alliance with JD (S)
content: The alliance with JD (S) was brokered by the high command with a larger perspective in mind, looking ahead at Assembly polls, says a strategist  SLUG: Civic polls

title: Rahul Gandhi calls for anti-discrimination law on Rohith Vemulaâ€™s death anniversary
content: The Congress leader says the situation facing Dalit students on campuses has not fundamentally changed, with institutionalised casteism, social exclusion and everyday humiliation continuing to deny equality of opportunity

title: RMC set to declare end of Northeast monsoon as rainfall activity wanes over T.N.
content: Officials of the RMC said conditions are turning favourable for cessation of monsoon rain over the south peninsular region, including Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal within two days

title: School arts festival sees its very first online contestant
content: Diagnosed with vasculitis L.K. Siya Fathima gets to contest in the Arabic Poster Designing competition. She secures â€™Aâ€™ Grade

title: Kerala delegation at World Economic Forum
content: State will showcase its ongoing transformation into a knowledge-based economy and industry-friendly ecosystem at its space in the India Pavilion

title: In fresh controversy, Tipra Motha founder says he will â€˜restore Tripura kingdomâ€™
content: Royal scion Pradyot Kishore Manikya urged Tiprasa people to keep thansa (unity) among themselves to retrieve lost glory

title: Chinnaswamy Stadium gets conditional nod to host matches; crowd capacity to be decided after safety review
content: The government has retained the authority to inspect the stadium at any stage and to revise or withdraw the permission if the compliance or safety arrangements are found to be inadequate

title: Infiltration changing West Bengalâ€™s demography: PM
content: PM assures refugees of protection under CAA, especially those from the Matua and Namasudras communities; accuses Trinamool of perpetuating illegal immigration, sparking riots

title: Cardiology department at SCTIMST celebrates its golden jubilee
content: Former heads of the department, current and former faculty members and cardiologists celebrate five decades of excellence in patient care and research.Â

title: ED searches premises linked to Piyush Group in alleged real estate fraud case
content: Despite collecting substantial booking amounts, the promoters did not deliver on the projects as promised, it is alleged; more than 2,000 homebuyers are stated to have been affected

title: Kapali comes alive with AMB Cinemas: Revival or setback for Kannada cinema?
content: AMB Cinemas burst onto the Bengaluru scene, unveiling South Indiaâ€™s first Dolby Screen at the iconic Kapali Theatre, once a hotspot for Kannada films

title: Revanth says meeting Modi will continue in Stateâ€™s interests
content: Chief Minister vows to complete all pending projects;  justifying his frequent visits to New Delhi for funds release saying that the give and take policy with the Centre would continue irrespective of what the Opposition claims

title: Huge support for tribal dances at Kerala school arts fest
content: Students from Govt. Model Residential School, Kulathupuzha, make their presence felt in the Irula Dance (Irula Nritham) competition

title: Rahul Gandhi to inaugurate â€˜Maha Panchayatâ€™ in Kochi on January 19
content: Around 14,000 party representatives, including 7,848 who had won the local body elections, will attend, said Mohammed Shiyas, president of the Ernakulam District Congress Committee, on Saturday (January 17, 2026).

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | Bold narratives take centrestage in Drama competition
content: The HSS category featured performances bold in vision and rich in energy; escalating production costs of plays remain a concern

title: DGCA slaps â‚¹22.2 crore penalty on IndiGo for flight cancellations after inquiry finds crew were being over stretched
content: IndiGo has also been ordered to pledge a bank guarantee of â‚¹50 crore to ensure compliance with the directives and long-term systemic correction

title: Airport expansion: Displaced families seek alternative sites, stage protest
content: Several people who have lost their houses and residential plots in the acquisition for Hubballi Airport expansion staged a protest in front of the Hubballi-Dharwad Urban Development Authority (HDUDA) office on Saturday, alleging delay in the allotment of alternate sites to the remaining displaced families.

title: Manipur government restoration: Biren Singh, Amit Shah discuss creating a â€˜conducive environmentâ€™
content: Sources close to the former Chief Minister say the two leaders discussed â€˜routine mattersâ€™ in second such meeting in a month

title: Vigilance panel meeting sees complaints against LSG, revenue officials
content: â€˜The complaints pertained to issues such as waste management in Thrikkakara municipality, inaction against pollution caused by quarrying, and alleged loss of land due following digital resurveyâ€™

title: Delivery Agent's Heroic Attempt To Help Techie Who Drowned In Noida
content: The delivery agent blamed the authorities for not taking any action, even when a truck had fallen in the ditch around 10 days ago.

title: Congress Handed Over Land To Infiltrators For Votes In Assam: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday accused the Congress of handing over Assam's land to infiltrators for votes during its rule in the northeastern state.

title: Techie Drowns In Noida Ditch, Told Father "Don't Want To Die" In Last Call
content: The incident took place on Friday night near Sector 150, when the techie, Yuvraj Mehta, was returning home from work.

title: On Camera, Truck Rams Cars At UP Toll Booth, Drags Employee For 50 Metres
content: A speeding truck crashed into two cars waiting at a toll plaza in Jhansi, Uttar Pradesh, leaving a toll employee and several passengers injured.

title: "Messages Can Go Through": Sanjay Raut Adds To Shinde Sena Hotel Suspense
content: As Shiv Sena chief Eknath Shinde keeps his 29 corporators in a five-star hotel, apparently to foil any poaching attempt after NDA's victory in the BMC polls, the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena (UBT) has added to the suspense

title: "He Fooled, Deceived Us": Iranian Protesters Say Trump "Betrayed" Them
content: For many Iranians who poured onto the streets during the latest wave of protests, US President Donald Trump appeared to be a potential lifeline. That belief, protesters say, is what makes his subsequent reversal feel like a betrayal.

title: Delhi Police Seize Drugs Worth Rs 5 Crore, 2 Nigerians Arrested
content: In a major crackdown on narcotics trafficking, the Delhi Police Crime Branch unit has dismantled an international drug syndicate operated by Nigerian nationals, seizing cocaine and MDMA tablets worth nearly Rs 5 crore.

title: After Congress MLA, Samajwadi Party Leader's "Internet Causes Rape" Remark
content: ST Hasan's remarks came in response to Congress MLA Phool Singh Baraiya's alleged comments on the reasons behind rape cases.

title: 'Fake' Pics Of Manikarnika Ghat Redevelopment Surface, Police Cases Filed
content: Eight separate cases have been lodged at Chowk Police station in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi against those allegedly spreading AI-generated images and misleading information on social media regarding the redevelopment work at Manikarnika Ghat.

title: Union Budget 2026: What Is The Economic Survey And Why It Is Important
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will table the Union Budget2026 in Parliament on February1. The Budget shows how the Centre plans to raise revenue and spend public funds for the upcoming financial year.

title: Union Budget 2026: How The Government Plans Its Finances Every Year
content: The Union Budget 2026, scheduled for February 1, is India's annual financial blueprint that will list how the government plans to generate revenue, allocate funds, and steer the economy over the coming year.

title: Mobile Phones, Cameras Banned In Char Dham Temple Complexes In Uttarakhand
content: Mobile phones and cameras will be completely banned in the temple complexes of Uttarakhand's Char Dham pilgrimage from this year.

title: Air India Express' Customised Boeing 737-8 MAX Takes 1st International Flight
content: Air India Express on Saturday operated its first international commercial flight of its newly inducted, fully custom-configured Boeing 737-8 Max aircraft.

title: Haryana's Saini Questions Punjab Flood Relief, AAP's Compensation Counter
content: Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini released funds under various schemes for farmers and beneficiaries of the Deendayal Ladli Lakshmi Yojana. During this event, Punjab government and Arvind Kejriwal of AAP were the main targets of Saini

title: "23 Shiv Sena Mayors": Team Uddhav's Dare To Eknath Shinde After BMC Result
content: As resort politics returns to Mumbai after the NDA's big win in the election to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena (UBT) has said the municipal elections are over, but the "real politics is yet to unfold"

title: Dense Fog Blankets Delhi-NCR, Low Visibility At Airport Amid Cold Wave
content: Residents of Delhi woke up to alarming air quality levels on Sunday morning as a thick blanket of toxic smog and dense fog engulfed the national capital, pushing pollution levels into the 'severe' category.

title: International Investment Fraud Busted In Delhi, Rs 4 Crore Routed To Cambodia
content: In a major crackdown on cyber-enabled financial crime, the Cyber Crime Cell of the Delhi Police dismantled a sophisticated interstate investment fraud syndicate with international links, arresting eight fraudsters across four states.

title: Resort Politics In Mumbai Again: Shinde Camp's Big Move After BMC Results
content: Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena has started moving its elected representatives in Mumbai to a five-star hotel, a day after it emerged as the kingmaker in theBrihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections.

title: 'Dangerous Downward Spiral': EU Warning Over US' Greenland Tariff Threats
content: European Union leaders on Saturday warned of a "dangerous downward spiral" over US President Donald Trump's vow to implement increasing tariffs on European allies until the US is allowed to buy Greenland.

title: Vance, Rubio To Attend Winter Olympics, Trump Missing In List Of Attendees
content: US Vice President JD Vance will lead an American delegation to the 2026 Winter Olympics in Italy and attend the opening ceremony, the White House said. Vance will be joined by US Secretary of State Marco Rubio

title: Points league rankings: Young and Davis slide, Sabonis returns
content: the fantasy basketball head-to-head points league player rankings are updated regularly throughout the season based on player performances, injuries, trades, signings and other trends . the team announced this week that Young's knee and quadriceps injuries would keep him out for at least the next month, if not longer . this news dropped Young to the bottom of the top-60 in points league rankings .

title: 'Communal reason for not getting work?' Remark by AR Rahman sparks outcry
content: AR Rahman's claims that he faced instances of "communal" discrimination in the last eight years in Bollywood caused an outcry on Saturday . he was asked, "maybe I didn't get to know all this stuff. Maybe God concealed all that stuff (laughed). I never felt all those..." before the question was completed .

title: Seahawks start fast and roll past 49ers, advance to NFC Championship Game
content: the Seahawks return the opening kickoff for a touchdown and never look back in a rout of the 49ers in the divisional round . coach Mike Macdonald's team now has an even stronger claim as the most complete team in this season's playoffs . the team's top-rated special teams got it started with Rashid Shaheed returning the kickoff 95 yards .

title: Why Miami's Columbus High School can't lose the CFP title game
content: the "Get Up" team gives its national championship picks . the school is 5 miles from the University of Miami and 20 miles from Hard Rock Stadium . it's home to the Explorers, who have seven people representing the school .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mets pivot to Bichette after Dodgers sign top free agent Tucker
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . the deal: three years, $126 million with opt-outs after first two seasons Grade: B- The new york Mets have a new heart .
